intro: Henckelia corneri, commonly known as the Sierra Leone hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of West Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
